PAD.synopsis: Halsin just appeared in the player's camp, seeking revenge for the destruction of the grove. After fighting Halsin and his animals. the party briefly reflects on what happened. This will only occur if the players sided with Minthara and Halsin didn't die previously.

CFM.synopsis: If the player sided with the goblins and helped sack the Grove, Halsin (if still alive) will show up at a subsequent camp night seeking vengeance. There's no way to calm him - the dialogue will always end with combat against him and some animals.

PAD_0.speaker: Player
PAD_0.text: First Druid, and now last druid. Thanks to us.

PAD_2.speaker: Player
PAD_2.text: We did what we did. Let's just see this through to the end.

PAD_1.speaker: Player
PAD_1.text: First Druid, and now last druid. Thanks to me.

CFM_1.speaker: Halsin
CFM_1.text: When I met you, I thought we were destined to be allies. But you made that impossible.
CFM_1.context: NodeContext: The player met Halsin before in the goblin camp. They could've become allies, but now that's impossible

CFM_11.speaker: Halsin
CFM_11.text: The grove stood for generations. It was our link to Silvanus. Now it's nothing but blood and ashes - thanks to you.
CFM_11.context: NodeContext: Cold fury. He's already wept for the grove - now he's here for retribution

CFM_4.speaker: Halsin
CFM_4.text: Tell me... was it worth it?
CFM_4.context: NodeContext: Rhetorical. He's not letting the player off the hook for what they did.

CFM_8.speaker: Player
CFM_8.text: Wait... who the hells are you?

CFM_13.speaker: Halsin
CFM_13.text: I am Halsin. First Druid of the Emerald Grove. And I am here to visit nature's fury upon you.
CFM_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.InternalNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.NodeContext: 'I'm the one who's going to kill you'

CFM_3.speaker: Player
CFM_3.text: Of course - I did what I had to do. Your grove got in the way.

CFM_2.speaker: Halsin
CFM_2.text: You have no idea what you've done, do you? Or perhaps you simply don't care?
CFM_2.context: NodeContext: Appalled and furious at the player's callousness.

CFM_9.speaker: Player
CFM_9.text: I'm sorry. I had no choice.

CFM_6.speaker: Halsin
CFM_6.text: There's always a choice - but you made yours. Now I make mine.

CFM_16.speaker: Player
CFM_16.text: Calm down. Come sit by the fire and we can talk this over.

CFM_0.speaker: Halsin
CFM_0.text: There's nothing left to be said. My mercy died when I saw the grove.
CFM_0.context: NodeContext: His mind is made up. It was made up before he appeared here.

CFM_12.speaker: Halsin
CFM_12.text: You have upended nature's balance. Only your death can restore it.
CFM_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues - Halsin + animals against the player.NodeContext: Resigned to the bloodshed to follow (combat immediately after this line)

CFM_5.speaker: Player
CFM_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues - Halsin + animals against the player.

CFM_7.speaker: Halsin
CFM_7.text: Look at you - camping amidst the Oak Father's creations, as if you hadn't just defiled  his most sacred ground.
CFM_7.context: NodeContext: Cold fury. He's already wept for the grove - now he's here for retribution

CFM_10.speaker: Halsin
CFM_10.text: Look at you - resting without a care, as if you hadn't just defiled  the Oak Father's most sacred ground.
CFM_10.context: NodeContext: Cold fury. He's already wept for the grove - now he's here for retribution

CFM_15.speaker: Halsin
CFM_15.text: I thought you'd help me. I thought we'd help each other. Instead you chose this.
CFM_15.context: NodeContext: The player met Halsin before in the goblin camp. They could've become allies, but now that's impossible
